descript.abstract: World Mountain Peaks, 1996 is a point theme representing mountain peaks worldwide. Attribute information includes the mountain name, the name of the mountain system, range, or territory where the peak is located, and the elevation of the peak.
descript.purpose: For educational, non-commercial purposes. This dataset is appropriate for use in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: The distribution and elevations of the highest parts of mountains, massifs, and ranges, are two of the most meaningful characteristics for describing and exploring the outer features of the earth's relief. Peaks, together with other relief characteristics such as morphology, genesis, and structure and components of the landscape, provide a better understanding of the present-day nature and economic development of the continents.

Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. procstep.procdesc: The database contains information on significant peaks. The data were acquired by cartographic, textual, and reference sources. The coordinates of the peaks were given by reference books and maps. The highest and most significant peaks were selected according to mountain systems and, in some cases, countries.
procstep.srcused: The Atlas of the World, Comprehensive Edition
Geograficheskiy Ehtsiklopedicheskiy Slovar': ponyatiya i terminy

procstep.procdesc: Datasets for each continent were converted from ESRI coverage to the ESRI shapefile format using the 'copy features' tool and merged into one layer using the 'merge' tool.
